questions.question_text:
A newly built custom dashboard needs to be available to a team of security analysts in ES.
How is it possible to integrate the new dashboard?

choices.D: Create a new role inherited from es_analyst, make the dashboard permissions read-only, and make this dashboard the default view for the new role.
choices.B: Add the dashboard to a custom add-in app and install it to ES using the Content Manager.
choices.A: Set the dashboard permissions to allow access by es_analysts and use the navigation editor to add it to the menu.
choices.C: Add links on the ES home page to the new dashboard.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
By setting the dashboard permissions to allow access by the es_analysts role and using the navigation editor to add it to the menu, you can ensure that the new custom dashboard is available and easily accessible to the team of security analysts in Splunk Enterprise Security.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A
I also think the answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
I think it is A, but am not sure

questions.question_text: What is the bar across the bottom of any ES window?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
P: 32 "Incident Review Dashboard"

Selected Answer: A
A. Priority and Severity.

Selected Answer: A
P: 33 "Notable Event Urgency"

questions.question_text: Which two fields combine to create the Urgency of a notable event?
What do threat gen searches produce?

choices.B: Threat intel in KV Store collections.
choices.D: Threat notables in the notable index.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Events in the threat_activity index.

Selected Answer: C
P: 278 "The Threat Intelligence Framework"

Selected Answer: C
Splunk Enterprise Security Admin Slides 309
B is correct but the question is worded incorrectly. Urgency is defined by priority of the asset or identity and the severity of the event (not the security)

questions.question_text: Which column in the Asset or Identity list is combined with event security to make a notable event's urgency?
